item.title: Lamppost that had been hit by a car last week is left leaning and base in cracked and broken pavement, coiuld fall any time on passerby. No tape or protection round it.up, 11th September
item.description:
Lampost (which had been hit by a car in an accident at the end of last week) is still leaning over and the base in the pavement is coming out. No protection to stop it falling on cars or passing pedestrians. Looks like it could be blown over!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Giles Coppice, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whiston Rd traffic enforcement camera looking skyward, 11th September
item.description:
The Whiston Road bus gate enforcement camera is currently pointing upwards and not at the junction. This camera's position has been widely reported on Facebook anti-LTN groups as an action they have done, and will continue to do to disrupt LTNs
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hay Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Island barriers loose and falling over, 11th September
item.description:
The barriers around the damaged island by Lloyds Way on Upper Elmers End Road have become detached. They have fallen over into the road in the high winds and causing an obstruction to traffic. Temporarily replaced but not fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are 2 large potholes outside of 30 Gravel Hill which are causing the road to sink which requires repairing urgently., 11th September
item.description:
There are 2 large potholes outside of 30 Gravel Hill which are causing the road to sink which requires repairing urgently. The road has been retarmacked previously, resident is concerned about this being a danger to the public and causing damage to cars as this is a busy road.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Report number 8128031, 11th September
item.description:
The above report is shown as Fixed but it is not. Firstly, nothing has been done to the dropped ironwork in the middle of the road. Secondly, some tarmac has been spread over at least half of the dropped drain at the side of the road. This has had the effect of partially blocking the drain itself without dealing with the "dropped ironwork" aspect at all. Potholes in the middle of the road in this area still need attention as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 279, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
